bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 14, 1900

div1.p: Carter writes that he has been summoned to Washington because his work in Havana may be finished.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 14, 1900
div1.p:
I am ordered to Washington &
will I judge leave in a week or
ten days. Orders somewhat
peculiar but am inclined
to think this ends my Cuban
detail, well the work here (at
Havana) is pretty well orga-
nized & I believe can be car-
ried on successfully without
me.

If I am mistaken in my sur-
mise as this ending my service
here, do not be disappoin-
ted, as coming back if it be
but for a little while is worth
much.

I am sick since Wednesday,
- not much sick but very un-
fortably so, never had much
fever 102 3/10 F. the highest & then
ng for some hours - run-
ning from 100 1/2 to 101 1/2 & this
morning down to 99 6/100, 1 degree above
normal only.

Yet I am weaker than a wet
string. No pain now or since Thurs-
day 8 P. M.

Dear love to all & hope to
see you soon
